descr: "An action that is or was performed on a patient. This can be a physical intervention like an operation, or less invasive like counseling or hypnotherapy."

fields.name: resourceType
fields.descr: "This is a Procedure resource"

fields.name: identifier
fields.descr: "This records identifiers associated with this procedure that are defined by business processes and/or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation)."

fields.name: status
fields.descr: "A code specifying the state of the procedure. Generally this will be in-progress or completed state."

fields.name: notDone
fields.descr: "Set this to true if the record is saying that the procedure was NOT performed."

fields.name: notDoneReason
fields.descr: "A code indicating why the procedure was not performed."

fields.name: category
fields.descr: "A code that classifies the procedure for searching, sorting and display purposes (e.g. \"Surgical Procedure\")."

fields.name: code
fields.descr: "The specific procedure that is performed. Use text if the exact nature of the procedure cannot be coded (e.g. \"Laparoscopic Appendectomy\")."

fields.name: performedDateTime
fields.descr: "The date(time)/period over which the procedure was performed. Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured."

fields.name: performedPeriod
fields.descr: "The date(time)/period over which the procedure was performed. Allows a period to support complex procedures that span more than one date, and also allows for the length of the procedure to be captured."

fields.name: reasonCode
fields.descr: "The coded reason why the procedure was performed. This may be coded entity of some type, or may simply be present as text."

fields.name: bodySite
fields.descr: "Detailed and structured anatomical location information. Multiple locations are allowed - e.g. multiple punch biopsies of a lesion."

fields.name: outcome
fields.descr: "The outcome of the procedure - did it resolve reasons for the procedure being performed?"

fields.name: complication
fields.descr: "Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period. These are generally tracked separately from the notes, which will typically describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues."

fields.name: followUp
fields.descr: "If the procedure required specific follow up - e.g. removal of sutures. The followup may be represented as a simple note, or could potentially be more complex in which case the CarePlan resource can be used."

fields.name: note
fields.descr: "Any other notes about the procedure.  E.g. the operative notes."

fields.name: usedCode
fields.descr: "Identifies coded items that were used as part of the procedure."

fields.name: contained
fields.descr:
"These resources do not have an independent existence apart from the resource that contains them - they cannot be identified independently, and nor can they have their own independent transaction scope."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: extension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: modifierExtension
fields.descr:
"May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the resource, and that modifies the understanding of the element that contains it. Usually modifier elements provide negation or qualification. In order to make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer is allowed to define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension. Applications processing a resource are required to check for modifier extensions."
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: id
fields.descr:
"The logical id of the resource, as used in the URL for the resource. Once assigned, this value never changes."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: implicitRules
fields.descr:
"A reference to a set of rules that were followed when the resource was constructed, and which must be understood when processing the content."
 derived from Resource
 derived from DomainResource

fields.name: language
fields.descr:
"The base language in which the resource is written."
 derived from Resource
